title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 June 2008 - XWiki
content:

xwikibot - (24/06/2008 08:08): Main.InstallationInstructions was modified by xwiki:XWiki.polx (my enrichments for re-runnable installations) - http://curriki.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/InstallationInstructions  
asyd - (24/06/2008 09:25): hello there  
steffen - (24/06/2008 10:14): Hello  
asyd - (24/06/2008 10:14): I create a class with a dynamic list, I want towrite a query to have get all pages using this classes, and the values of the list  
asyd - (24/06/2008 10:14): I wrote the following query:  
asyd - (24/06/2008 10:15): select obj.name, prop.value from BaseObject obj, LargeStringProperty prop where obj.className = 'class' and obj.id = prop.id and prop.name = 'name'  
asyd - (24/06/2008 10:15): however prop.value seem to be an object, but I don't know what kind of object  
asyd - (24/06/2008 10:16): ah hmm my bad  
asyd - (24/06/2008 10:32): is there a split in velocity ? Since a multichoice is stored in a single column  
xwikibot - (24/06/2008 10:43): XWiki.QorusQorus was modified by XWiki.QorusQorus (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/QorusQorus  
asyd - (24/06/2008 10:44): I just want to split a variable using velocity/hql pff  
asyd - (24/06/2008 11:04): May I use a velocity scripts to compute the list of availables choses for a list ? (class's property)(  
steffen - (24/06/2008 11:25): How can I get the value of a variable easily (without setting up a full dev environment)? I'm searching for something like 'print' in python...  
jvdrean - (24/06/2008 11:30): steffen: can you be more precise ? what variable ? where do you want to print it ?  
steffen - (24/06/2008 11:30): I'm hit by this bug: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-227  
steffen - (24/06/2008 11:30): I need to know which value getScheme() returns.  
steffen - (24/06/2008 11:31): I'm running version 1.5m1  
steffen - (24/06/2008 11:31): And the fix, mentioned in this bug report is already in there, but it seems not to fix \_anything\_  
steffen - (24/06/2008 11:31): ok. except the hard-coded http...  
steffen - (24/06/2008 11:41): Something is wrong in XWiki. After changing the code from getting the scheme through getScheme() to hard-coded 'https', some urls are still prefixed by 'http'.....  
steffen - (24/06/2008 12:09): Has somebody xwiki working over ssl?
